API¶

setup_celldrift¶

CellDrift._setup.setup_celldrift(adata: AnnData, cell_type_key: str, perturb_key: str, size_factor_key: str, time_key: Optional[str], batch_key: Optional[str], control_name: Optional[str], perturb_name: Optional[list] = None, use_pseudotime: bool = False, pseudotime_n_bins: int = 10, n_reps: int = 3, n_cells_perBlock: int = 50, min_cells_perGene: Optional[int] = None)[source]¶

Set up CellDrift with key words set.

Parameters

  • adata – AnnData as the input.

  • cell_type_key – The key in adata.obs that indicates cell type assignments.

  • perturb_key – The key in adata.obs that indicates perturbation assignments

  • size_factor_key – The key of size factor for anndata. e.g. n_counts.

  • time_key – The key of time point indicator. Values in this covariate must be numeric

  • batch_key – The key of batch covariate.

  • control_name – control value in the perturb_key.

  • perturb_name – a list of perturbation labels of interest. Default is None. If None, all unique values apart from control_name from perturb_key will be used.

  • use_pseudotime – whether time key is pseudotime or not. Default is False.

  • pseudotime_n_bins – number of pseudotime bins if use_pseudotime is True. Default is 10

  • n_reps – number of replicate runs of CellDrift. Default is 3.

  • n_cells_perBlock – number of cells in each (cell type + perturbation + time point) combination. Default is 50

  • min_cells_perGene – filtering criteria for genes. Default is None.

Examples:

import scanpy as sc
import CellDrift as ct
kc = 'Cell_Type'
kp = 'Disease_State'
kt = 'Time_Since_Onset'
kp_p = 'COVID_SEVERE'
kp_c = 'CTRL'
adata = sc.read('test.h5ad')
adata = ct.setup_celldrift(
    adata, 
    cell_type_key = kc, 
    perturb_key = kp, 
    time_key = kt,
    control_name = kp_c, 
    perturb_name = None, 
    size_factor_key = 'size_factor', 
    batch_key = None,
    min_cells_perGene = 200,
    use_pseudotime = False
)

model_timescale¶

CellDrift._model.model_timescale(adata, n_processes=16, chunksize=100, adjust_batch=True, add_dummy=True, pairwise_contrast_only=False, output_suffix=None)[source]¶

run the GLM model across multiple time points. Also refer to model_genes to see model for one time point.

Parameters

  • adata – CellDrift anndata after running setup_celldrift.

  • n_processes – number of processors for multiprocessing. Default is 16.

  • chunksize – number of genes for each processor. Default is 100.

  • adjust_batch – whether to adjust batch effect in the generalized linear model. Default is True.

  • add_dummy – whether to add dummy values to resolve the sparse input of single-cell data. (Not implemented)

  • pairwise_contrast_only – whether to output pairwise contrast coefficients only. Default is False, which means the results also include other output from the GLM model.

  • output_suffix – suffix characters to be added in each output file. Default is None.

fda_cluster¶

CellDrift._temporal.fda_cluster(fd, genes, n_clusters=20, seed=42, suffix='', output_folder='Temporal_CellDrift/')[source]¶

Find functional data analysis clusters.

Parameters

  • fd – FDA object.

  • genes – genes used to run clustering algorithms.

  • n_clusters – number of clusters. Default is 20.

  • seed – random seed. Default is 42.

  • suffix – suffix in the name of output file.

  • output_folder – location of output folder.

draw_smoothing¶

CellDrift._temporal.draw_smoothing(fd, method='nw', n_neighbors=2, bandwidth=1, output_folder='Figures_CellDrift/', fig_name_suffix=None)[source]¶

Draw a smoothed curve for functional data.

Parameters

  • fd – FDA object, such as the FDA object for all cell-type+perturbation combinations in a specific gene.

  • method – method of smoothing, including knn, llr and nw. Default is nw

  • n_neighbors – number of neighbors for Kernel Smoothing method KNeighborsHatMatrix. Default is 2.

  • bandwidth – bandwidth of Kernel Smoothing method LocalLinearRegressionHatMatrix. Default is 1.

  • output_folder – output folder for smoothing figures.

  • fig_name_suffix – suffix in the output figure name.

draw_smoothing_clusters¶

CellDrift._temporal.draw_smoothing_clusters(fd_whole, df_cluster, n_neighbors=2, bandwidth=1, cluster_key='clusters_fuzzy', output_folder='Temporal_CellDrift/figures/', ylim=None)[source]¶

Draw smoothed curves for all CellDrift derived clusters.

Parameters

  • fd_whole – FDA object, such as the FDA object for all genes in a specific cell-type+perturbation combination.

  • df_cluster – dataframe of cluster output from function fda_cluster.

  • n_neighbors – number of neighbors for Kernel Smoothing method KNeighborsHatMatrix. Default is 2.

  • bandwidth – bandwidth of Kernel Smoothing method LocalLinearRegressionHatMatrix. Default is 1.

  • cluster_key – the key of cluster in the data frame df_cluster

  • output_folder – output folder for smoothing figures.
